nodes.bodyText: I thought we decide the generic external service log will go to greengrass.log. Did you change your mind?

I think that's a matter of classification. I looked through all 25 logs and made a choice. I moved everything that was external, like exit code and stdout/stderr.
Happy to change if you don't agree.
Why createChild? Why not just use the component logger?

What would the name of the log file? Is it COMPONENT_NAME.log? What would happen if the name collides with the log file created by the customer's component code (e.g. if they use log4j in their code)? Would it be better name it COMPONENT_NAME.stdout?
Customer's can't log into our log directory, they don't have permissions.

createChild is needed so that setting the dfltKV values for one instance of a lambda doesn't also affect other instances of it. See the same code in GreengrassService, we do the exact same thing there as well.
Any reason to make this a final class? I was thinking of having the kernel logging topics subscribed here so that this class and only this class will be responsible for any logging config changes.
You can still do that with a static method. Just LogManagerHelper.handleNucleusLogs(kernel) do that call when we startup, something like that. That method can subscribe as needed
